verses.verse: The burden<WH4853> of the desert<WH4057> of the sea<WH3220>. As whirlwinds<WH5492> in the south<WH5045> pass<WH2498> through<WH935>; so it comes from the desert<WH4057>, from a terrible<WH3372> land<WH776>.

A severe<WH7186> vision<WH2380> is declared<WH5046> unto me<WH898>; the treacherous dealer deals treacherously<WH898>, and the spoiler<WH7703> spoils<WH7703>. Go up<WH5927>, O Elam<WH5867>: besiege<WH6696>, O Media<WH4074>; all the sighing<WH585> there have I made to cease<WH7673>.

Therefore is my body<WH4975> filled<WH4390> with pain<WH2479>: pangs<WH6735> have taken hold<WH270> upon me<WH6735>, as the pangs of a woman in childbirth<WH3205>: I was bowed down<WH5753> at the hearing<WH8085> of it<WH926>; I was dismayed at the seeing of it<WH7200>.
My heart<WH3824> panted<WH8582>, fearfulness<WH6427> frightened<WH1204> me<WH5399>: the night of my pleasure<WH2837> has he turned<WH7760> into fear unto me<WH2731>.

For thus has the Lord<WH136> said<WH559> unto me<WH3212>, Go, set<WH5975> a watchman<WH6822>, let him declare<WH5046> what he sees<WH7200>.

And he answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, Babylon<WH894> is fallen<WH5307>, is fallen<WH5307>; and all the engraved images<WH6456> of her gods<WH430> he has broken<WH7665> unto the ground<WH776>.

O my threshing<WH4098>, and the corn<WH1121> of my floor<WH1637>: that which I have heard<WH8085> of the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, have I declared unto you<WH5046>.
The burden<WH4853> of Dumah<WH1746>. He calls<WH7121> to me out of Seir<WH8165>, Watchman<WH8104>, what of the night<WH3915>? Watchman<WH8104>, what of the night<WH3915>?
The watchman<WH8104> said<WH559>, The morning<WH1242> comes<WH857>, and also the night<WH3915>: if you will inquire<WH1158>, inquire<WH1158> you<WH7725>: return, come<WH857>.
The burden<WH4853> upon Arabia<WH6152>. In the forest<WH3293> in Arabia<WH6152> shall you lodge<WH3885>, O you travelling companies<WH736> of Dedanim<WH1720>.
The inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776> of Tema<WH8485> brought<WH857> water<WH4325> to him<WH7125> that was thirsty<WH6771>, they met<WH6923> with their bread<WH3899> him that fled<WH5074>.

For they fled<WH5074> from<WH6440> the swords<WH2719>, from<WH6440> the drawn<WH5203> sword<WH2719>, and from<WH6440> the bent<WH1869> bow<WH7198>, and from<WH6440> the grievousness<WH3514> of war<WH4421>.
For thus has the Lord<WH136> said<WH559> unto me<WH8141>, Inside a year, according to the years<WH8141> of a hireling<WH7916>, all the glory<WH3519> of Kedar<WH6938> shall fail<WH3615>:

And the residue<WH7605> of the number<WH4557> of archers<WH7198>, the mighty men<WH1368> of the sons<WH1121> of Kedar<WH6938>, shall be few<WH4591>: for the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> has spoken it<WH1696>.
